nodes.bodyText: I think we should reuse previous doAuthentication method, and wrap exceptions here. Is there a reason for you to create a new one?
the previous method combines the two exception types. i can use that original method and check the error message here to throw for different cases
Lets change the method signature to throw a different exception when input is invalid, like illegalArgument, and then catch it here. Relying on message string makes it easily breakable in future.

sure. should not rely on error message.
I added this when I was unclear between InvalidToken and Unauthorized errors. now I wonder if all the UnauthenticatedException should throw InvalidTokenError, including it being invalid and unassociated with the service. while UnauthorizedError is used for checking if component is authorized to request the API (for now only Stream Manager)

Yeah. Authentication is misleading here. API is for components to see if a token is valid or not. Internally we are calling authentication to determine that but, for customer they only care if the token is valid or not. I think we can safely return invalidToken for all cases except for Unauthorized case as you mentioned.
create a public const for the stream manager name. We would want to use it in lambda as well (we already have a const in lambda, but we can switch to yours if you make it public)
thanks, added the public const it here
